japanese:
……おい。
勉強を見てもらいたいと言われて来てみれば、
これは一体どういうことだ？
translation:
...Hey.
I was asked to come and help with studying,
but what exactly is going on here?

japanese: ちょっと騒がしいけど、気にしないで。
translation: It's a bit noisy, but don't worry about it.

japanese:
おっ、フータロー君やっと来たね？
ほらほら、今ならみんなの秘蔵写真を見放題だよ？
translation:
Oh, Futaro-kun, you finally made it!
Look, now you can see everyone's
secret photos to your heart's content.

japanese:
スマホで撮ってたのをプリントしてみたの。
島の想い出として、ちょうどいいでしょ？
translation:
I printed out the ones we took with our smartphones.
They're perfect as memories of the island,
don't you think?

japanese:
あああああ……。
こんな写真、いつ撮ってたんですか……。
translation:
Aaaaaahhh...
When were these photos taken?

japanese:
こっちは花火したときのだね。
おお、らいはちゃんが可愛く撮れてる～！
translation:
This one was taken when we had fireworks.
Ooh, Raiha-chan is so cute in this one!

japanese:
……大変に盛り上がっていて結構だが、
夏休みの課題をするんじゃなかったのか？
translation:
...It's great that everyone's having fun,
but weren't we supposed to be doing our summer homework?

japanese:
島から戻ってからフータローと会ってなかったし、
１人で寂しがってないかと思って。
translation:
We haven't seen you, Futaro,
since we got back from the island,
so we thought you might be feeling lonely by yourself.

japanese:
まだ夏休みは残ってるしさ。
島での想い出話をするのもいいんじゃない？
translation:
Well, summer vacation still isn't over.
Why don't we talk about our memories from the island?

japanese:
あ、そうです！
想い出といえば――
translation:
Oh, that's right!
Speaking of memories%p-2;――

japanese:
らいはちゃんから頂いた水晶、
ひとまず私が受け取っていましたが、
どうしましょう？
translation:
Raiha-chan left me with her crystal,
but what should I do with it?

japanese:
しまっておくのももったいないですし、
お守りとして、順番に持ち歩きますか？
translation:
It would be a waste to just put it away.
Should we take turns carrying it as a good-luck charm?

japanese:
飾っておくのもいいかも。
キッチンとか玄関とか、どうかな？
translation:
It might be nice to display it, too.
In like, the kitchen, or near the entrance?

japanese:
そうすれば、らいはちゃんが
遊びに来てくれたとき、一緒に見られるし。
translation:
That way, when Raiha-chan comes to visit,
we can look at it together.

japanese:
それ、いいね。
可愛いお皿の上に、小物と一緒に並べてさ。
きっとらいはちゃんも喜んでくれるよ。
translation:
That sounds good.
Like, on a cute plate with some other items.
Raiha-chan will definitely be happy with it.

japanese:
でも、掃除のときなんかに
うっかりなくさないように注意しないと。
translation:
But we need to be careful
not to accidentally lose it when we clean, or anything.

japanese: ……それ、一花が言う？
translation: ...Is that really your line, Ichika?

japanese:
あ、電話が。
すみません、失礼しますね。
translation:
Ah, I have a phone call.
Excuse me for a moment.

japanese:
飾るのもいいけど、
いっそアクセサリーに加工してもらって
結婚式で使うってのもありじゃないかしら？
translation:
Displaying it would be nice,
but what if we had it made into an accessory,
and used it at our weddings?

japanese:
うん、それもいいかも！
ネックレスとか、ティアラに使うとか。
らいはちゃんにも見てもらえるもんね。
translation:
Yeah, that would be nice!
Like as a necklace, or a tiara.
Raiha-chan would be able to see it, too.

japanese:
気の早い話を……。
ん、というか、お前ら、結婚式にまで
らいはを呼ぶ気なのか。
translation:
Isn't this talk a bit premature...?
Hm, well, you guys, are you really planning
on inviting Raiha to your wedding?

japanese:
あら、呼ぶなんてつもりはないわよ？
だってそのときは隣に……ふふっ！
translation:
Oh, no, I'm not planning to invite her, or anything?
Because I'll be next to... Teehee!

japanese:
ねえ、フー君はどっちがいい？
結婚式で使うなら、ネックレスか、ティアラか。
もちろん別のものでもいいわ。
translation:
Hey, Fu-kun, which is better? If it'll be used for
our weddings, should it be necklace, or a tiara?
Of course, it could be something else entirely.

japanese: ……なんで俺に聞くんだよ。
translation: ...Why are you asking me?

japanese:
上杉さん、こういうのは難しく考えないで
好きなほうを選べばいいんですって。
translation:
Uesugi-san, you don't have to think too hard about this.
Just pick whichever one you like.

japanese:
そうそう、参考までに聞いてるだけだもの。
ここはフー君の好きなほうでいいのよ？
ねえ、どっちが好き？
translation:
That's right,
we're just asking for your opinion as a reference.
Which one do you like better?

japanese: だから……聞く相手を間違えてるぞ。
translation: Look... You're asking the wrong person.

japanese: 上杉君、ちょっといいですか？
translation: Uesugi-kun, could I speak with you a moment?

japanese: あ、ああ、なんだ？
translation: Y-yeah, what's up?

japanese: あっ、もう！
translation: Aah, you!

japanese: 逃げられちゃったねー。
translation: He escaped.

japanese: 父が、あなたと代わってほしいそうです。
translation: My father wants to talk to you, apparently.

japanese: は？　俺と？
translation: Huh? With me?

japanese:
（なんの用だ？
　もしかして、らいはを診てもらったことで
　何か……）
translation:
(What does he want?
 Is it about Raiha,
 and something to do with her check-up?)

japanese:
お世話になっております、お父さん！
らいはの件はありがとうございました！
translation:
Thank you for all your help, Dad!
I really appreciate what you've done for Raiha!

japanese: 君にお父さんと呼ばれる筋合いはないよ。
translation: You have no reason to call me 'Dad.'

japanese:
妹さんの体調は、なんの問題もなくて幸いだったね。
その後はどうかな？
translation:
The condition of your younger sister
was fortunately fine, with no issue.
How has she been since?

japanese: はい、おかげさまで健康そのものです。
translation: Yes, thanks to you, sir, she is in perfect health.

japanese: それはよかった。
translation: That's great to hear.

japanese:
ところで、先ほどそちらから
『結婚式』という言葉が聞こえたのだが。
translation:
By the way, I heard the word 'wedding' from your end
earlier.

japanese: えっ！？
translation: Huh?!

japanese:
二乃君の声だったと思うが、
君との会話で、そのような単語が出てくる理由が
思い当たらなくてね。
translation:
I think it was Nino's voice,
I cannot think of any reason why that word
would come up in conversation with you.

japanese: どういうことか説明してもらいたい。
translation: I would like you to explain the reason.

japanese:
（さっきのを聞かれたのか！
　説明しろって言われても……）
translation:
(He heard what we were talking about earlier!
 Even if he asks me to explain...)

japanese: どうして黙っているのかな？
translation: Why are you being silent?

japanese: いえ、その、深い意味などなくてですね！？
translation:
Ah, well, there was no deeper meaning to it,
or anything, sir!

japanese:
娘たちとは、あくまで家庭教師として、
紳士的に接してくれていると信じていたのだが……。
translation:
I believed that you would treat my daughters
as a private tutor, with a gentleman's attitude...

japanese:
も、もちろんです！　当然じゃないですか！
俺は紳士的に接していますとも！
translation:
O-of course!
I am always a gentleman when I interact with them!

japanese:
……そうか。
では、これ以上は追求しないことにしよう。
translation:
...I see.
Let's not pursue this matter any further.

japanese:
君は確かに、別荘にいたあいだも
娘たちを正しく導いてくれたようだからね。
translation:
You certainly guided my daughters properly
during your stay at the villa.
Ah...

japanese:
これからも励んでくれたまえ。
それでは失礼するよ。
translation:
Please continue to work hard.
Well then, I shall take my leave now.

japanese: はああぁぁ……。
translation: *sigh*

japanese:
（今回は見逃してくれたってことか？
　それとも親父さんも多少は俺のことを……
　いや、それはないよな……）
translation:
(Did their dad let me off the hook this time?
 Or maybe he thinks of me in a slightly better
 light... No, that's not possible, right?)

japanese:
上杉君、父となんの話を？
もしかして、また何か……。
translation:
Uesugi-kun, what were you talking to my father about?
Is something going on again?

japanese: い、いや、そんなことはないんだが。
translation: N-no, nothing like that.

japanese:
上杉さーん！
写真、まだまだありますよ。
みんなで見ましょう。
translation:
Uesugi-saaan!
There are still more photos to see.
Let's all look at them together!

japanese:
って、勉強はどうした！
俺は想い出話をしに来たわけじゃないぞ！
translation:
What about studying?
I didn't come here to reminisce!

japanese:
えー？
今日はもうそんな気分じゃないよ。
translation:
Huuuh?!
I'm not in the mood for it today.

japanese:
１日くらい、いいじゃない。
夏休みはまだあるんだし。
translation:
Can't we take a break for a day?
After all, it's still summer vacation.

japanese:
よくねぇ！
ほら、写真はどけろ！
教科書とノートを持ってこい！
translation:
No, we can't!
Move those photos aside!
Bring me your textbooks and notebooks!

japanese: ……フータローのケチ。
translation: ...Futaro, you're being stingy.

japanese:
ケチじゃない。
俺はお前らの家庭教師だからな、
これが当然なんだよ。
translation:
I'm not being stingy.
As your tutor, this is only natural.

japanese:
さあ、勉強するぞ！
お前らを、全員揃って笑顔で卒業させてやる！
translation:
Alright, let's study!
I'll make sure all of you graduate
with smiles on your faces!
